intro: Syngonanthus goyazensis var. hatschbachii, commonly known as the Goyazensis var. Hatschbachii, is a rare shrub native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It features small, elliptical leaves with a smooth, glossy surface and a dense, compact growth habit. The plant produces clusters of white to pale pink flowers, which are typically arranged in terminal inflorescences. Its botanical significance lies in its restricted distribution and unique morphological characteristics. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
